title: How to Make Moretum (Garlic Cheese)

steps.headline: Have a mortar and pestle ready.
steps.description: You will want to use a marble one, because the smell will never come off of a wooden one, and a plain, smooth ceramic one can be troublesome. The rougher surface of stone will also make it easier to use.

steps.headline: Peel 2-5 garlic cloves, your choice, and mince them.
steps.description: Put these in the mortar and pound them until somewhat pasty. Add a pinch of salt and mix.

steps.headline: Grate 2.5 to 5 oz of Romano cheese, or mince by hand.
Mix the cheese into the garlic until well blended.
Add a teaspoon of olive oil and 1/2 tsp of white wine vinegar; mix.
Pick out a few sprigs of fresh cilantro [coriander leaves] and chop finely with a sharp knife.
Add the leaves and 1/2 tsp of dill; mix again.
Add any additional herbs and spices.
Mix and pound again until spices are well-distributed and you have a slightly lumpy paste.
Spread the chunky paste as thinly as you can manage [it's not that spreadable] onto fresh slices of French baguettes.
